subject: College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Bo Pelini, the defensive coordinator at Louisiana State, is expected to be named the head coach at Nebraska, two sources with direct knowledge of the situation said last night. Pelini served as the defensive coordinator at Nebraska in 2003 and was the interim coach in the Cornhuskers’ Alamo Bowl victory against Michigan State that season after Frank Solich was fired. After leaving Nebraska, Pelini was co-defensive coordinator at Oklahoma. The hiring is expected to become official after L.S.U. plays Tennessee in the Southeastern Conference title game today.
